intro: Pithecellobium tortum f. scalare, commonly known as the scalared pita, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a legume, typically containing several seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
